items.title: Ancient amphibian had mouthful of teeth ready to grab you
items.summary: The idea of being bitten by a nearly toothless modern frog or salamander sounds laughable, but their ancient ancestors had a full array of teeth, large fangs and thousands of tiny hook-like structures called denticles on the roofs of their mouths that would snare prey, according to paleontologists.

alternate.title: Ancient amphibian had mouthful of teeth ready to grab you

thumbnail.title: Ancient amphibian had mouthful of teeth ready to grab you

items.title: The body's own fat-metabolism protects against the harmful effects of sugar
items.summary: Researchers have discovered that the fat-metabolism in the cells takes place simultaneously with a detoxification of the harmful substances from the blood sugar, which can avert the damage that can in turn lead to age-related diseases such as diabetes, Alzheimer's and cancer. This indicates that we have a detoxification system which we were not previously aware of.

alternate.title: The body's own fat-metabolism protects against the harmful effects of sugar

items.title: Scientists question study about plastic-eating caterpillars
items.summary: Do the larvae of the wax moth really solve the world's plastic problem? Sensational report of biochemical degradation of polyethylene by caterpillars not confirmed.

alternate.title: Scientists question study about plastic-eating caterpillars

thumbnail.title: Scientists question study about plastic-eating caterpillars

items.title: 'Exciting' discovery on path to develop new type of vaccine to treat global viruses
items.summary: Scientists have made a significant discovery in efforts to develop a vaccine against Zika, dengue and Hepatitis C viruses that affect millions of people around the world.

alternate.title: 'Exciting' discovery on path to develop new type of vaccine to treat global viruses

items.title: Why we did not evolve to live forever: Unveiling the mystery of why we age
items.summary: Researchers have made a breakthrough in understanding the origin of the ageing process. They have identified that genes belonging to a process called autophagy -- one of the cells most critical survival processes -- promote health and fitness in young worms but drive the process of ageing later in life.

alternate.title: Why we did not evolve to live forever: Unveiling the mystery of why we age

thumbnail.title: Why we did not evolve to live forever: Unveiling the mystery of why we age

items.title: Immune system linked to alcohol drinking behavior
items.summary: Researchers have found a new link between the brain's immune system and the desire to drink alcohol in the evening.

alternate.title: Immune system linked to alcohol drinking behavior

items.title: Time to dial back on diabetes treatment in older patients? Study finds 11 percent are overtreated
items.summary: Almost 11 percent of Medicare participants with diabetes had very low blood sugar levels that suggested they were being over-treated, a new study finds. But only 14 percent of these patients had a reduction in blood sugar medication refills in the next six months.

alternate.title: Time to dial back on diabetes treatment in older patients? Study finds 11 percent are overtreated

items.title: Couples weather bickering with a little help from their friends
items.summary: New research finds that having good friends and family members to turn to alleviates the stress of everyday conflict between marital partners. Social networks may help provide protection against health problems brought about by ordinary tension between spouses.

alternate.title: Couples weather bickering with a little help from their friends
